data.title: CCIE and CCNP Certified Cisco Router Consulting: Maintenance, Updates, and Troubleshooting
meta_keywords: Cisco RV Series VPN Series Router Consulting Services
Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router Remote Support
Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router Consulting Services
Cisco CRS Carrier Routing System Series Router Remote Support
Cisco IOS XR Software Consulting Services
data.meta_description: Progent can provide planning and debugging help for Cisco's older routers as well as for Cisco's current routers such as Cisco 1000 and 4000 Series Integrated Services routers, Cisco Meraki MX Series routers, Cisco ASR 9000 WAN aggregation routers, and Cisco Catalyst 8500 WAN Edge appliances.
data.text:
Today's routers typically incorporate Layer 2 switching capability, and many of today's switches include L3 routing capability. Routers developed by Cisco, the source of the vast majority of the world's routers, have improved significantly in capability and speed and Cisco offers an extensive product line that includes routers designed to meet the needs of users from individual telecommuters to the world's largest ISPs.

The most recent Integrated Services Routers from Cisco have the performance and built-in features to manage data voice and video plus virtualization while also providing high availability, web-based administration, seamless expandability, and enhanced protection. These routers allow your company to establish a solid foundation for an information network that can evolve seamlessly as you add more employees, open extra offices, configure new capabilities, extend your network to clients and partners, and support an expanding mobile workforce. Progent's Cisco CCIE network consultants can provide immediate and affordable remote support to assist your company to select, configure, manage, upgrade, and troubleshoot Cisco's most advanced router technology and can help you to support your older routers or migrate efficiently to Cisco's newer networking products.

Cisco Routers for Home Offices and Small Offices and Branches

Cisco's routers for smaller companies and remote offices offer affordable and dependable no-frills solutions that enable limited sets of users to share safe connectivity to wide area networks. These fixed-configuration desktop routers include at least four 10/100 switched Ethernet with wireless options and integrated firewall to provide enhanced protection. Built for simple installation, administration, and support, Cisco's small business and home routers minimize TCO by lowering equipment and maintenance investments. Progent's online troubleshooting specialists have extensive experience delivering fast and economical technical help for small organizations to set up and maintain these routers, and Progent's CCIE-certified network engineers can help your company to understand whether and how Cisco's small office routers can increase the strategic value of your information system.

ISR 900 Series Routers

Cisco's ISR 900 Series routers are small-footprint, fanless, set-configuration devices designed for SMBs, branches, and home offices. These entry-level routers include four managed GE switch ports and offer Metro Ethernet, LTE, and DSL WAN connectivity. Cisco's ISR 900 router product line provides triple the IPsec throughput of Cisco's ISR 800 Series routers. All ISR 900 models offer Group Encrypted Transport VPN, dynamic multipoint virtual private network VPN (DMVPN), Cisco FlexVPN, and firewall. VPN performance is up to 250 Mbps. All versions allow up to 50 VLANs. Supported dynamic failover technology for high availability include Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol, HSRP, and Multigroup HSRP. Setup and management can be performed with Cisco CP Express, Cisco DNA Center, and Cisco IOS Software. Cisco ISR 900 Series devices do not work with Cisco SD-WAN.

Cisco's ISR 921 router features dual GE WAN ports, LTE Cat 4, and an internal power supply. GE WAN VPN throughput is 150 Mbps. Cisco's ISR 926 and ISR 927 models use external power supplies and support a single WAN port, LTE Cat 4, plus VDSL2 and ADSL2/2+ high-speed broadband. VPN throughput for both routers is 150 Mbps. The top-of-the-line ISR 931 router features dual GE WAN ports and includes an internal power supply. VPN performance is 250 Mbps.

Cisco Meraki MX Series SD-WAN Security Appliances

The Cisco Meraki MX family of desktop routers combine software-defined wide area networking (SD-WAN) and cloud-based unified threat management (UTM) in one compact appliance able to handle 50 to 200 users. Each MX series appliance needs to be licensed to the Meraki cloud. For sites having several WAN network options (e.g., MPLS, broadband, cellular), SD-WAN technology permits administrators to specify the WAN connection a given app uses or to create performance-based rules to select the appropriate connection. Cisco Meraki MX fixed-configuration desktop routers share important capabilities including:

Application and identity-based firewalling

Content and web search filtering

PCI-compliant Intrusion Detection and Prevention

Advanced Malware Protection with sandboxing

Load balancing to aggregate multiple WAN connections into one fast connection with policy-based QoS, traffic shaping, and fast failover

Works with all IPsec VPN devices and services

USB port for fast 3G/4G failover

Wi-Fi versions of each model have 802.11ac Wave 2 2x2 MU-MIMO

The MX64 security appliance provides 250 Mbps firewall throughput, 100 Mbps site-to-site VPN performance, and supports a maximum of 50 VPN connections. The MX64 comes with a GbE RJ45 WAN port, a dual-purpose GbE RJ45 WAN/LAN port, and four GbE RJ45 LAN ports. The MX67 router offers 500 Mbps firewall performance, 300 Mbps site-to-site VPN throughput, and allows up to 50 VPN tunnels. The MX67 includes a GbE RJ45 WAN interface, a dual-purpose GbE RJ45 WAN/LAN interface, and four GbE RJ45 LAN ports. The Cisco Meraki MX68 security appliance delivers 600 Mbps stateful firewall throughput, 300 Mbps site-to-site VPN performance, and supports up to 50 VPN tunnels. The MX68 comes with two fixed GbE RJ45 WAN ports and 10 fixed GbE RJ45 LAN interfaces (two include PoE+). The Cisco Meraki MX75 router provides 1 Gbps firewall performance, 500 Mbps site-to-site VPN performance, and allows a maximum of 75 VPN tunnels. The MX75 includes one GbE SFP interface, two fixed GbE RJ45 WAN ports, and 10 GbE RJ45 LAN ports (two include PoE+).

Cisco 1000 Family ISR Branch Routers

Cisco 1000 and 1100 family Integrated Services Routers (ISRs) powered by Cisco IOS XE software are a line of fanless appliances designed to provide network connectivity, wireless access, and advanced cybersecurity for SMBs, enterprise branch offices, retail outlets, customer premises equipment (CPE), and M2M environments. Multiple parallel processing cores and the ability to run Cisco IOS XE software allow these routers to deliver features consistent with Cisco's complete line of modern Enterprise routers. 1000 Series ISR routers are offered with 4 or 8 LAN switch ports and provide Gigabit Ethernet packet forwarding. Available features include PoE and PoE+, auto provisioning, plus a range of built-in or pluggable connections including LAN, WAN, WLAN, G.fast DSL, 3G/4G Advanced wireless, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, and SFP. Cisco 1000 Series ISR routers work with Cisco's SD-WAN subscription services for transparent multi-cloud connectivity, multilayer cybersecurity, and cohesive management across hybrid network models of any complexity.

Cisco's rackmount or desktop ISR 1100-4G router comes with four built-in GE WAN/LAN ports, built-in 3G/4G LTE wireless with two LTE antenna connectors, and a micro-SIM slot. Encryption throughput is 200 Mbps. The ISR 1100-6G router adds two 1G SFP ports and features encryption performance of 520 Mbps. Cisco's desktop 1101-4P ISR router includes four built-in switched GE ports, supports 802.11ac Wi-Fi as well as 3G/4G LTE wireless, and delivers encryption throughput of 280 Mbps. The Cisco ISR 1109-2P/4p desktop routers include two or four integrated switched GE ports and two pluggable 3G/4G LTE ports. Encryption speed is 200 Mbps.

The Cisco rackmount or desktop 111x-4P/8P ISR routers have four or eight integrated GE interfaces (two or four with Power over Ethernet) and support VDSL2/ADSL2+, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, 3G/4G LTE wireless, and SFP. Encryption packet processing performance is 280 Mbps. Cisco's 1RU or desktop ISR 1111X-8P router has eight GE ports (four with POE) and supports 1G SFP. Encryption packet processing speed is 340 Mbps. The 112x-8P ISR router has eight built-in switched GE ports with PoE and supports SHDSL, VDSL2/ADSL2+, 802.11ac, 3G/4G LTE wireless, and SFP Fiber. Encryption speed is 340 Mbps. Cisco's 1161X-8P ISR router has eight integrated switched GE ports with Power over Ethernet and provides 3G/4G LTE and SFP Fiber. Encryption performance is 450 Mbps.

Cisco Catalyst 8000 Series Branch and WAN Edge Platforms for SD-WAN and Routing

Cisco Catalyst 8000 family of routers are modular devices designed to work at the enterprise branche and the WAN edge in support of hybrid networks that can incorporate a mix of public and private clouds and SaaS applications. All Catalyst 8000 routers use Cisco IOS XE SD-WAN Software and offer expandability, intelligent cloud security, and 5G access. Throughput is enhanced via custom hardware, a multicore architecture, high port density, and line-rate encryption. Cisco's subscription software suites offer continual access to current SD-WAN technology and enable unified management with enhanced security, application-based policies, network segmentation, and cloud readiness.

Catalyst 8200 Enterprise Branch Edge Routers

Catalyst 8200 Series routers are successors to Cisco's 4300 Series ISRs, offering higher IPsec throughput and expandability, hardware-accelerated crypto, plus higher integrated WAN interface density. These one-rack unit routers are designed to provide Cisco's Secure Access Service Edge (SASE), SD-WAN and 5G-interface technology to enterprise branch offices and the enterprise access edge. Cisco's Catalyst C8200L-1N-4T model includes four CPU cores, supports 500 Mbps IPsec performance, and permits 1,500 SD-WAN tunnels. Cisco's Catalyst 8200L platform does not support container-based applications. Cisco's Catalyst C8200-1N-4T model includes eight CPU cores, provides 1Gb IPsec performance, permits 2,500 SD-WAN tunnels, and allows edge computing with in-place container architectures. Both appliances come with a Network Interface Module slot, a Pluggable Interface Module (PIM) slot, two 1 Gigabit Ethernet WAN interfaces, and two 1G Ethernet WAN SFP interfaces. 4-port and 8-port 1G Ethernet switch NIM modules are supported by both 8200 routers.

Cisco Catalyst 8300 Enterprise Branch Edge Routers

Cisco Catalyst 8300 Series WAN Edge routers are intended to supersede Cisco's 4400 line of ISR Routers, providing Cisco's secure SD-WAN architecture to mid-sized and large enterprise branches looking for high WAN IPSec performance with integrated SD-WAN services. Advanced capabilities include 5G wireless support, integrated cybersecurity, WAN MACSec, enhanced Layer 2 switching, and Deep Packet Inspection with application-aware optimization. Catalyst 8300 routers enable edge computing for an in-place container environment for Cisco UCS-E modules offered on Cisco's 4000 line of ISR routers. All models in the Cisco Catalyst 8300 family allow 4,000 SD-WAN tunnels and feature dual power supplies for high uptime.

The Cisco Catalyst 8300-1N1S-6T router is a one-rack unit device that includes 8 CPU cores and offers 2G SD-WAN performance and IPsec performance of up to 1.9Gbps. The router comes with a single SM expansion slot, one Network Interface Module slot, and six integrated 1G Ethernet WAN interfaces. The Catalyst 8300-2N2S-6T device is a two-rack unit model that features 8 CPU cores and supports 2G SD-WAN performance and IPsec performance as high as 1.9Gbps. The appliance has two Service Module plug-in slots, two NIM slots, and six built-in 1-Gigabit Ethernet WAN ports. The Cisco Catalyst C8300-1N1S-4T2X router model is a 1RU appliance that has 8 CPU cores and supports 5G SD-WAN data rates and IPsec throughput up to 15Gbps. The model includes one one Service Module expansion slot, one NIM slot, two integrated 10-Gigabit Ethernet WAN ports, and four built-in 1-Gigabit Ethernet WAN ports. The Cisco Catalyst C8300-2N2S-4T2X device is a 2RU appliance that features 12 CPU cores and supports 5G SD-WAN performance and IPsec data rates up to 18Gbps. The unit includes two Service Module expansion slots, two NIM slots, two built-in 10-Gigabit Ethernet WAN ports, and four fixed 1G Ethernet WAN ports. LAN modules modules available from Cisco range from a four-port 1-Gigabit Ethernet switch NIM module to a 50-port Catalyst L2 switch Service Module.

Cisco Catalyst 8500 Aggregation Edge Routers

The Catalyst 8500 Aggregation Edge routers are fixed, one-rack unit aggregation models for SD-WAN and colocation deployments. Integrated features include route processor, embedded services processor, plus aggregation hardware for various connection choices. IPsec performance is twice that of Cisco's earlier generation ASR1001-X router. Available connectivity alternatives include 1GE, 10GE, 40GE, and 100GE WAN ports. These routers come with redundant power supplies for improved availability. Software subscription suites allow continuing access to Cisco DNA Center Software for SD-WAN and routing and offer centralized management of security, application-based policies, network segmentation, and cloud support.

The Catalyst C8500L-8S4X Aggregation Edge router is intended to provide a similar basic functionality as Cisco's ASR 1000 router. The C8500L-8S4X includes four 1/10GE WAN interfaces and can deliver as high as 20 Gbps aggregate performance. SD-WAN IPsec throughput is up to 19Gbps. The Catalyst C8500-12X appliance has 12 built-in 1/10GE WAN interfaces and supports up to 120 Gbps aggregate data rates. SD-WAN IPsec performance is up to 51 Gbps. The C8500-12X4QC unit includes four built-in 1/10GE WAN interfaces and eight 1GE ports and can support up to 200 Gbps aggregate performance. SD-WAN IPsec performance can reach 68 Gbps. The Catalyst C8500-20X6C high-density router includes 20 built-in SFP+ ports and 6 x 40/100GE interfaces. The Catalyst C8500-20X6C supports up to 500 Gbps Cisco Express Forwarding aggregate performance.

Cisco Integrated Services Generation 2 Routers

Cisco's Integrated Services G2 routers are intended to offer satellite offices of enterprises with advanced collaboration, virtualization, security, and reliable WAN access. Integrated Services G2 routers feature a design that protects prior investments in modules for older Integrated Services Routers and lowers future costs by allowing easy upgrades to new modules as they are developed. In comparison to previous Integrated Services Routers, Cisco's Integrated Services Generation 2 routers feature 2-7 times more throughput, far greater expandability, and easier maintenance. All Cisco Integrated Services G2 routers offer GE switching and incorporate multi-core processors and multigigabit fabric for higher performance. Integrated Services G2 routers also support intelligent power management for improved energy efficiency.

A notable advance with Integrated Services Generation 2 routers is the Cisco IOS Software Universal image which contains all of the IOS feature sets so that you can quickly authorize and deploy new services as required without having to acquire and transfer a different IOS image to yourCisco router. Progent's team of Cisco-certified CCIE network engineers offer world-class expertise to assist your business to plan, configure, and maintain multi-location installations of Cisco ISR Generation 2 routers that enhance branch office productivity and cut the costs of upgrades and maintenance.

Cisco's ISR 800 Series Routers

The 800 Series of ISR routers has been functionally replaced by the higher performance Cisco ISR 900 series but remains widely used. Cisco's comprehensive portfolio of 800 Series ISR routers consists of desktop, fanless appliances intended for small businesses, branch locations, retail venues, telecommuters, and clients of ISPs. A wealth of models in Cisco's 800 Series product line have been released with various options over many years. The 881 Series of ISR routers suggests the vast array of options available within Cisco's 800 line of routers. Models in Cisco's 881 Series router catalog can enable converged media environments by providing voice and video, Wi-Fi and cellular wireless and data in a single integrated router and switch. Advanced data protection can include encryption, VPN tunneling, firewall, and URL filtering. For business continuity, available options for 881 ISR routers include redundant WAN connections or support for wired high-speed WAN connections like DSL as well as multiple different 3G and 4G wireless WAN connections all built into a single desktop appliance.

Cisco's 881 of ISR routers allow a broad range of deployment scenarios

The basic Cisco 881 router includes a 4-port 10/100-Mbps managed switch with up to 15 Mbps throughput, support for up to 20 users, two-port integrated PoE, and IPv6 support. Cisco's 881W ISR router supports 802.11g/n Wi-Fi. Cisco's 881 SRST router includes four FXS ports and 1 FXO port for public-switched-telephone-network (PSTN) fallback with Cisco Survivable Remote Site Telephony (SRST). With a Cisco CUBE license, the Cisco 881 ISR router supports SIP trunking as a replacement for outdated Primary Rate Interface (PRI) lines or FXO voice connectivity to a PSTN service provider. SIP trunks can also support remote agents in Cisco Call Center deployments.

4000 Series ISR Routers

The Cisco 4000 Series Integrated Services Routers are compact modular and scalable routers intended for businesses with a large number of branch offices and remote users who need direct access to private data centers as well as public clouds across VPNs and the Internet. The 4000 series provides the throughput needed for hybrid WAN environments to support mobile workers, Cloud-based services, and multimedia applications by utilizing WAN optimization, deep packet inspection, and advanced traffic-management technology. Devices in the ISR 4000 family are powered by Cisco's powerful IOS XE software, come in a 1RU or 2RU form factor, can handle as much as 2 Gbps of throughput, and can include up to 3 interface slots, 2 service module slots, 4 built-in Gigabit Ethernet ports, and 8 CPU core integrated server modules. ISR 4000 models can support integrated Gigabit Ethernet, T1/E1, T3/E3, PR1, xDSL and other interfaces. For unified communications, Cisco's 400o ISR provides comprehensive edge support technology for session border control, branch telephony fault tolerance, and Time Division Multiplexing gateways.

The main difference between the Cisco 4400 and 4300 Series Routers is redundant power supply capability in the 4400 Series, providing a higher degree of availability. Cisco's 4321 ISR Router comes in a 1 RU desktop form factor with two network interface modules (NIMs), delivers up to 100 Mbps performance, and allows up to 240 Digital Voice and Video Channels. The 4331 model has a 1 RU package and includes two NIMs, offers as much as 300 Mbps performance, and supports 360 Digital Voice and Video Channels. Cisco's 4351 model comes in a 2 RU package with three NIMs, delivers as much as 400 Mbps performance, and can handle 720 Digital Voice/Video Channels. The dual power supply 4431 router comes in a 2 RU package with three NIMs, delivers as much as 1 Gbps performance, and allows up to 720 Digital Voice and Video Channels. Cisco's redundant-power 4431 router has a 2 RU form factor and includes three network interface modules, provides as much as 2 Gbps performance, and can handle 1200 Digital Voice and Video Channels.

Cisco's WAN Edge Routers and Carrier-class Routers

Cisco's WAN edge and carrier routers can provide enterprises with fast, protected head ends to aggregate branch office and remote user data packets and to provide service providers cost-optimized wide area network edge routing. Cisco's WAN aggregation and service provider router portfolio features the Cisco ASR 1000 product line and the 9000 Series Aggregation Services routers.

Progent's national team of Cisco CCIE certified network consultants have extensive backgrounds working with enterprise businesses and service providers to plan efficient installations and seamless expansion of Cisco's midrange and carrier-class routers. Progent's GIAC-certified information assurance experts offer objective, third-party network security inventory assessments, penetration testing services and advanced Security information and Event Management (SIEM) solutions to help companies with Cisco's WAN aggregation routers to meet business standards and government requirements for network information security and reporting. Progent also can provide help with Horizon3.ai's NodeZero platform for threat assessment. NodeZero relies on AI technology to streamline the vulnerability assessment cycle of discovering cybersecurity gaps in perimeters and within the internal network, prioritizing remediation, mitigating weaknesses, and confirming fixes.

Cisco ASR 1000 WAN Edge Routers

Cisco's ASR 1000 Series WAN Edge line of routers is positioned in the center of Cisco's midrange devices that focus on aggregating services at the wide area network edge. ASR 1000 Series WAN Edge routers provide a small form factor, single-product answer for large businesses requiring branch office aggregation at supergigabit Ethernet performance. ASR 1000 Series Aggregation Services routers introduce a revolutionary design that mixes hardware acceleration with programmable versatility in order to deliver a rich set of concurrent services without sacrificing dependable responsiveness.

ASR 1000 Aggregation Services routers include Cisco's proprietary QuantumFlow Processor incorporating 40 purpose-built Packet Processing Engines (PPEs) that in combination can handle as many as 160 concurrent threads. This multi-processing structure, combined with on-board acceleration for all services, enables the top-of-the-line ASR 1006 WAN Edge router to expand up to 128 hardware queues, 32,000 subscribers, 4K IP security tunnels at 10K sessions/second, and 2M Netflow log records. This processing capability allows Cisco's ASR 1000 routers to support a broad range of advanced services concurrently in massive volume without suffering performance degradation that could compromise compliance with service level agreements. Examples of these services include IOS Firewall, intrusion-detection services, NAT, Flexible Packet Matching, and deep packet inspection. The Cisco ASR 1000 also allows tiered traffic control for applying numerous levels of Quality of Service to a data packet in a single pass, enhancing responsiveness for resource-intensive multimedia applications.

Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers

Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers are designed as WAN-edge routers for service providers who are required to deliver world-class HD multimedia services to home, business, and mobile customers by providing continual operation, high performance, and application awareness. All models in the ASR 9000 portfolio of Aggregation Services Routers run the IOS XR operating system, a distributed operating system built for continuous availability. Throughput of the Cisco ASR 9000 Series of Aggregation Services Routers can be expanded to as high as 96 Tbps per chassis. Cisco's ASR 9000 portfolio of Routers support high-density Gigabit Ethernet (GE), 10 GE, and 100 GE and have redundant fabric and power modules, power entry modules, and fan trays plus redundant switch fabric.

The ASR 9001 model is a provider-edge router in a 6 RU package that delivers 120 Gbps of full-duplex fabric performance. The Cisco ASR 9001 has two modular bays to support port adapters for 1 Gigabit, 10 Gigabit, and 40 Gigabit Ethernet. The chassis includes four 10 Gbit Ethernet SFP+ ports as well as ports for Stratum 1 clocking, building integrated timing supply (BITS), and management. The Cisco ASR 9904 Router comes in a 6 RU chassis and provides line-rate 10 and 100 Gigabit Ethernet connectivity in space-limited environments. The 4-slot router can support up to 4 Tbps of capacity in a single chassis. The ASR 9912 Router comes in a 30 RU form factor with 10 line-card slots that can support 550 Gbps of switching capacity. The Cisco ASR 9912 has 2 route CPUs and 6+1 Fabric Cards for N+1 redundancy.

How Progent Can Assist You to Support Cisco Router Products

Progent's CCIE and CCNP certified consultants can assist you to plan, configure, and support a converged business network that can simplify operations, reduce expenses, and accelerate the path to positive ROI. By teaming Cisco routers with Catalyst switches expertise and Catalyst and Meraki Wi-Fi wireless expertise, Progent can significantly enhance the strategic value of your integrated network. Progent can provide on-premises and remote support and can provide data center support throughout the U.S.

To find out more details concerning Progent's engineering expertise for Cisco solutions, choose a topic:
